1.text: Fill a large pot about 2/3 full of water.

2.text: Cover the pot and bring the water to a boil.

3.text: Add salt and 1 pound (450 g) of pasta to the boiling water.

4.text: Set a timer for 3 to 8 minutes.

5.text: Stir the noodles occasionally as they boil.

6.text: Bite into a noodle to see if it's cooked enough for you.

7.text: Scoop out about 1 cup (240 ml) of pasta water and set it aside.

8.text: Set a colander in the sink and put on oven mitts.

9.text: Pour the pasta into the colander and shake it.

10.text: Avoid adding oil or running cold water over the pasta if you plan on using sauce.

11.text: Put the pasta back into the pot and toss it with your choice of sauce.

12.text: Toss short noodles with pesto or vegetables.

13.text: Mix cheese into macaroni or shells to make a creamy pasta.

14.text: Serve meaty sauce over tubular or wide pasta.

15.text: Stir creamy alfredo sauce into long pasta.
